item.title: PHP: The Right Way
item.author: kc0bfv@notmet.net (Karl Sickendick)
item.description: There are a lot of pitfalls to using PHP, and they bite new users quickly. “Spot the vulnerability” is a cool site which highlights examples of these pitfalls: http://spotthevuln.com/ (BROKEN NOW) Of course, PHP is a pretty speedy way to develop any type of server-side web code. Josh Lockhart has put together a list of best practices for PHP development and tailored it to new PHP developers: http://www.phptherightway.com/ If developers would follow the recommendations in the databases section it would take care of so many vulnerabilities out there today.
